alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Hempstead; Lafayette; Miller; Nevada; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 12 at 6:06AM CDT until July 12 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR FOR STAMPS, BUCKNER AND EXTREME NORTHEAST LAFAYETTE COUNTY... ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN UNION, NORTHERN COLUMBIA, SOUTHEASTERN HEMPSTEAD, NORTHEASTERN LAFAYETTE, EAST CENTRAL MILLER AND SOUTHERN NEVADA COUNTIES... At 606 AM CDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 8 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for For Stamps, Buckner and Extreme Northeast Lafayette County. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. Multiple roads have been reported as impassible. Flooding is occurring inside buildings in Stamps. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... El Dorado, Magnolia, Hope, Smackover, Stamps, Waldo, Lewisville, Norphlet, McNeil, Buckner, Perrytown, Rosston, Willisville, Bodcaw, Village, Mount Holly, Lisbon, Calhoun, Mount Vernon and Cale. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
